New Records: Malik Monk scored a team-high 31 points and DeMar DeRozan added 29 points in the Sacramento Kings' 138-130 win over the Memphis Grizzlies on January 4, 2025.
Key Match Events: The Sacramento Kings came back from a 110-109 deficit to win the game with a 20-10 run capped by Malik Monk's game-winning three-pointer with 4:21 remaining in the fourth quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: Zach Edey returned from a two-game absence due to a concussion and had nine points and seven rebounds off the bench.
Post-Match Reflections: The Sacramento Kings made 29 of 59 shots from the field (52.7%) while the Grizzlies knocked down 26 of 50 shots (52%). The teams combined for 150 points in the first half.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Malik Monk made his debut with the Sacramento Kings in the first quarter after undergoing left shoulder surgery last July.
Others: Devin Carter, the son of Grizzlies assistant coach Anthony Carter, made his debut with the team in the first quarter.
